story:
Tarot of Cyclicity - life is rhythm

The traditional depiction of the cards is explicit and static. The scenes represent situations while the solutions are at the discretion of the interpreter. Everything follows according to predefined scenarios. When someone saw a lying man face down on the ground and stabbed in his back with ten oversised swords, there is none or very little room left for interpretation.

The Waite-Smith’s Ten of Swords is arbitrary, definitive and irreversible. It speaks about the violent end and an inevitable tragic outcome.

However, life is not a series of snapshots, but it is a flowing movie. Life means motion because nothing is static in the universe. Situations are changeable, and humans can make their own choices and determine their own fates. Life is rhythm.

The Ten of Swords of the Tarot of Cyclicity leave someone’s options open. Ten possible escape paths penetrate the circles of the blades.

With the Tarot of Cyclicity you can choose and you can write your own scenarios. You have the possibility to change the rhythm and make your life better. 

A little bit of philosophy

Life on Earth is cyclical and our lives may feel sometimes like we are running in the same circle all over again. It is in your power to break the circle. 

In theory, the average life expectancy is 84 years - although currently, it is of only 71 years. The 84 years can be divided into 12 'slices' of 7 years each.  Each slice represents one Zodiac sign. These 12 slices can be further divided into three. These are the 36 decans of the Zodiac represented by the 36 numerals of the Tarot deck. Each Zodiac sign has three decans and one decan is approximatively 2 years and 4 months. We traverse these decans one by one from the day we were born till the day we will die. We live our lives exposed to all these external, human and astral influences unknowingly, unconsciously. Our life is a long string of 'accidents' and unpredictable happenings where we are only passive participants. Life is happening to us. However, by conscious effort, learning and spiritual development, we have the power to change that and transform the circle of life into an upward spiral of evolution. The Tarot is the map of the universe and the guide to the path of enlightenment. 

The cards of the Tarot of Cyclicity are like mirrors. You can only see yourself and the things you know. More you will learn, more you will be able to see and understand.

Tarot & therapy - know thyself

The Tarot is not only an advanced instrument for making predictions - educated guesses, but it is also an instrument of self-observation, self-remembering, self-study and therapy. Know yourself and you will understand others; study others and you will learn about yourself.

Combining both teachings of Gurdjieff and Jung, the Tarot can be an important part of the healing and developing processes. 

Someone can lay out the cards face up and chose a couple of cards or ask another person to draw some cards. Studying these cards may shred a new light upon someone's current state of mind and soul.

And this is just one of the countless possibilities. The Tarot of Cyclicity is a flexible tool and everyone can find and develop the method of using it which way suits her or him the best.  The only limits are those that someone imposes on themselves. The round shape of the cards suggests the infinite nature of the universe and of our possibilities. For individual or group therapy, the Tarot of Cyclicity opens up new paths of exploration and study. 

Focusing on the cards you will embark on a fantastic journey.  

The regular and round editions

  • The regular edition consists of 78 Tarot cards plus one cover card and an extra card which features the core of the system, respectively the basic astrological, numerological, alchemical and cabalistic attributions of the cards. The cards will be delivered in a custom rigid tuck box.
  • The cards of the regular edition feature upright and reversed keywords on each card and the time frame associated with each card. For instance, Two of Wands represents the period from March 21 to March 30, respectively the 1st decan of Aries. Upward the card signifies initiative, while reversed doubt.
  • The round edition consists of 78 Tarot cards, one cover card and five extra cards which features basic Astrology and astrological attributions of the Tarot cards. The cards will be delivered in a custom rigid box.
  • The Minor Arcana cards of the round edition additionally feature the classic symbols of each suite.
  • Smooth and easy to handle.
  • Superior smooth quality card stock: 330gsm finest German card stock with black core.
  • Round deck dimensions: 89mm x 89mm, 3.5" x 3.5".
  • Regular deck dimensions: 70mm x 121mm, 2.75" x 4.75".

The three cards reading

With these three cards promotional reading, we will dive into the relationship of conscious, subconscious and unconscious. 
No matter what is on your mind, what is the issue that most concerns you right now, you should take into consideration these three aspects.

The seventy-eight cards of the Tarot deck are dividable into three. These three categories represent what in Astrology we call Cardinal, Fixed and Mutable Qualities.


The 1st card represents the Fixed quality, respectively the conscious.
The 2nd card represents the Cardinal quality, respectively the subconscious.
The 3rd card represents the Mutable quality, respectively the unconscious.

You will receive the three cards I have drawn specially for you and the written interpretation by mail. 

Tarot Renewal, the book

No more digital booklets - sorry! I am concerned about the constant process of dematerialisation, which, paradoxically is parallel with the constant loss of spirituality versus consumerism and materialism. A book is a book, it is worth something spiritually and it has weight physically.  A book should be something special, something truly Magick!

Although not integrated part of this ongoing campaign, the book is an important component of this project. Later this year, a large accompanying printed book entitled "Tarot Renewal" will be published and it will be available separately on Lulu, a print-on-demand platform. However, please keep in mind that the price of the Tarot decks does not include the printed book. 

The book is a complete theoretical and practical guide. It includes a brief history and analyses of the evolution of the esoteric Tarot and the use of the deck for game playing across Europe. 

The book will introduce basic notions of Astrology, Numerology and Alchemy and how they are fully integrated into the Tarot. It will also feature both traditional and modern interpretation of the cards as a foundation for your own further development.  Not at least, will present technics of reading the cards, respectively use the cards for self-development and therapeutical purposes. 

Accessories and clothes

A large collection of clothes and accessories based on the design of the Major Arcana cards, including t-shirts, tanks, sweatshirts, pullover hoody, zip-up hoody, fine art prints, stretched canvas, mounted aluminum prints, mounted acrylic prints, blankets, duvets, shower curtains, rugs, tapestries, throw pillows, bath mats and many accessories including stickers, phone cases, mugs, water bottles, bags, notebooks, zip pouches and beach towels are available exclusively on threadless.com. It's time to renew your wardrobe with a little bit of Magick!

Risks & Challenges

This is my third rodeo on IndieGoGo, and I like to believe that there will be no surprises. The two previous decks were published and safely delivered. However, this doesn't mean we won't be facing challenges.  Sometimes getting the funds transferred takes longer than normally should. There is always something going not according to plan when printing. International shipping is always complicated.  I added extra time in the planning just to be sure.

The flexible goal means that if only one person will contribute, she or he will be the only one who will get the deck at the 10% off discount price. It is simple like that!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can not contribute maybe you know other people who might be interested. Please get the word out and make some noise about this project. Any help is highly appreciated! 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much!
story_txt:
Tarot of Cyclicity - life is rhythm
The traditional depiction of the cards is explicit and static. The scenes represent situations while the solutions are at the discretion of the interpreter. Everything follows according to predefined scenarios. When someone saw a lying man face down on the ground and stabbed in his back with ten oversised swords, there is none or very little room left for interpretation.
The Waite-Smith’s Ten of Swords is arbitrary, definitive and irreversible. It speaks about the violent end and an inevitable tragic outcome.

However, life is not a series of snapshots, but it is a flowing movie. Life means motion because nothing is static in the universe. Situations are changeable, and humans can make their own choices and determine their own fates. Life is rhythm.
The Ten of Swords of the Tarot of Cyclicity leave someone’s options open. Ten possible escape paths penetrate the circles of the blades.
With the Tarot of Cyclicity you can choose and you can write your own scenarios. You have the possibility to change the rhythm and make your life better. 
A little bit of philosophy
Life on Earth is cyclical and our lives may feel sometimes like we are running in the same circle all over again. It is in your power to break the circle. 
In theory, the average life expectancy is 84 years - although currently, it is of only 71 years. The 84 years can be divided into 12 'slices' of 7 years each.  Each slice represents one Zodiac sign. These 12 slices can be further divided into three. These are the 36 decans of the Zodiac represented by the 36 numerals of the Tarot deck. Each Zodiac sign has three decans and one decan is approximatively 2 years and 4 months. We traverse these decans one by one from the day we were born till the day we will die. We live our lives exposed to all these external, human and astral influences unknowingly, unconsciously. Our life is a long string of 'accidents' and unpredictable happenings where we are only passive participants. Life is happening to us. However, by conscious effort, learning and spiritual development, we have the power to change that and transform the circle of life into an upward spiral of evolution. The Tarot is the map of the universe and the guide to the path of enlightenment. 
The cards of the Tarot of Cyclicity are like mirrors. You can only see yourself and the things you know. More you will learn, more you will be able to see and understand.

Tarot & therapy - know thyself
The Tarot is not only an advanced instrument for making predictions - educated guesses, but it is also an instrument of self-observation, self-remembering, self-study and therapy. Know yourself and you will understand others; study others and you will learn about yourself.
Combining both teachings of Gurdjieff and Jung, the Tarot can be an important part of the healing and developing processes. 
Someone can lay out the cards face up and chose a couple of cards or ask another person to draw some cards. Studying these cards may shred a new light upon someone's current state of mind and soul.
And this is just one of the countless possibilities. The Tarot of Cyclicity is a flexible tool and everyone can find and develop the method of using it which way suits her or him the best.  The only limits are those that someone imposes on themselves. The round shape of the cards suggests the infinite nature of the universe and of our possibilities. For individual or group therapy, the Tarot of Cyclicity opens up new paths of exploration and study. 
Focusing on the cards you will embark on a fantastic journey.  

The regular and round editions

The regular edition consists of 78 Tarot cards plus one cover card and an extra card which features the core of the system, respectively the basic astrological, numerological, alchemical and cabalistic attributions of the cards. The cards will be delivered in a custom rigid tuck box.
The cards of the regular edition feature upright and reversed keywords on each card and the time frame associated with each card. For instance, Two of Wands represents the period from March 21 to March 30, respectively the 1st decan of Aries. Upward the card signifies initiative, while reversed doubt.
The round edition consists of 78 Tarot cards, one cover card and five extra cards which features basic Astrology and astrological attributions of the Tarot cards. The cards will be delivered in a custom rigid box.
The Minor Arcana cards of the round edition additionally feature the classic symbols of each suite.
Smooth and easy to handle.
Superior smooth quality card stock: 330gsm finest German card stock with black core.
Round deck dimensions: 89mm x 89mm, 3.5" x 3.5".
Regular deck dimensions: 70mm x 121mm, 2.75" x 4.75".

The three cards reading
With these three cards promotional reading, we will dive into the relationship of conscious, subconscious and unconscious. No matter what is on your mind, what is the issue that most concerns you right now, you should take into consideration these three aspects.
The seventy-eight cards of the Tarot deck are dividable into three. These three categories represent what in Astrology we call Cardinal, Fixed and Mutable Qualities.
The 1st card represents the Fixed quality, respectively the conscious.The 2nd card represents the Cardinal quality, respectively the subconscious.The 3rd card represents the Mutable quality, respectively the unconscious.
You will receive the three cards I have drawn specially for you and the written interpretation by mail. 
Tarot Renewal, the book
No more digital booklets - sorry! I am concerned about the constant process of dematerialisation, which, paradoxically is parallel with the constant loss of spirituality versus consumerism and materialism. A book is a book, it is worth something spiritually and it has weight physically.  A book should be something special, something truly Magick!
Although not integrated part of this ongoing campaign, the book is an important component of this project. Later this year, a large accompanying printed book entitled "Tarot Renewal" will be published and it will be available separately on Lulu, a print-on-demand platform. However, please keep in mind that the price of the Tarot decks does not include the printed book. 
The book is a complete theoretical and practical guide. It includes a brief history and analyses of the evolution of the esoteric Tarot and the use of the deck for game playing across Europe. 
The book will introduce basic notions of Astrology, Numerology and Alchemy and how they are fully integrated into the Tarot. It will also feature both traditional and modern interpretation of the cards as a foundation for your own further development.  Not at least, will present technics of reading the cards, respectively use the cards for self-development and therapeutical purposes. 

Accessories and clothes
A large collection of clothes and accessories based on the design of the Major Arcana cards, including t-shirts, tanks, sweatshirts, pullover hoody, zip-up hoody, fine art prints, stretched canvas, mounted aluminum prints, mounted acrylic prints, blankets, duvets, shower curtains, rugs, tapestries, throw pillows, bath mats and many accessories including stickers, phone cases, mugs, water bottles, bags, notebooks, zip pouches and beach towels are available exclusively on threadless.com. It's time to renew your wardrobe with a little bit of Magick!
Risks & Challenges

This is my third rodeo on IndieGoGo, and I like to believe that there will be no surprises. The two previous decks were published and safely delivered. However, this doesn't mean we won't be facing challenges.  Sometimes getting the funds transferred takes longer than normally should. There is always something going not according to plan when printing. International shipping is always complicated.  I added extra time in the planning just to be sure.
The flexible goal means that if only one person will contribute, she or he will be the only one who will get the deck at the 10% off discount price. It is simple like that!

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you can not contribute maybe you know other people who might be interested. Please get the word out and make some noise about this project. Any help is highly appreciated! 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you very much!

story:
Story

 

I’m Ladan Tofighi, an Iranian artist living and working in Milan, Italy.

Working as an artist has been a challenge my entire life, from working as a female artist in my home country, Iran, to being an immigrant who works as an Iranian artist internationally.

 

Besides that, over the past year, COVID-19 has rapidly changed our lives. As an illustrator and painter, I have been trying to tackle the challenge of selling my works. Most events and exhibitions got cancelled, so finding different ways of sharing my artworks and connecting to the world has been vital for progress.

Fortunately, the exhibitions and events are beginning to show signs of reopening. In recent months I have participated in many international open calls to reconnect with live audience, which mostly required paying participation fees. In addition, if your artworks are accepted, you are burdened with the cost of renting the space and shipping the artworks. Due to these high costs, I had to withdraw from many exhibitions. This is why I decided to launch a campaign to raise funds that will allow me to participate in exhibitions and start making money as an artist again.

To see my paintings hop over to my website:

https://ladantofighi.com/

 

What the money raised is being applied to:

 

I am using this campaign to pay for the cost of the participation of my latest project _a series of oil paintings on canvas_ in the calls and exhibitions, rent of space, shipping of paintings, and travel expenses.

Putting on a show has a lot of expense. The largest is of course the rental fee, so that takes a large share of the funding. Additionally there is the cost of transportation of  large paintings on canvas  ( 120.100 cm, 2 70.100 cm, 50.70 cm) and travel expenses. 

Open calls and exhibitions which I’m participating

 Art Fair Frankfurt

Itsliquid

Focus art fair

Artkeys prize

Innovate grant

Innovative Grant

Hopper prize

Air Gallery, United Kingdom

Haze Gallery, Berlin  

mazemagazine

With your help, I will be able to use  4,000 euros to sell my artworks and make up for a low financial period. I cherish your love and support; every euro counts!

Thank you for taking the time to consider funding me.

 

The rewards in details and images:

 

Fan of the Arts ~ €10 - 

Thank you for the love and support! *Sending virtual hugs!*

 

Friend of the Arts ~ €25 or more 

This pledge comes with a personal Thank You and a high resolution digital file of your choice ready for print right to your mailbox!

 

Admirer of the Arts ~ € 50  or more 

With this pledge you'll receive two(2) signed 10.15 cm fine-art prints of your choice on 285gr. Fedrigoni recycled uncoated paper. Printed in Italy.

 

 

Enthusiast of the Arts ~ € 75 or more

You'll receive two(2) signed A4 prints of your choice on 285gr. Fedrigoni recycled uncoated paper. Printed in Italy.

 

 

Supporter of the Arts ~ € 100 or more

With this pledge you'll receive four(4) signed A4 prints on 285gr. Fedrigoni recycled uncoated paper + Stickers of my selected works from my other series. Printed in Italy.

 

Contributor to the Arts ~ €250 or more

You will receive 4(four) A4 prints + A 10.15 cm original Artwork. 

 Original art work could be: 

1. Commissioned portraits: I draw your portraits on water color paper, following my artistic style, as many people or animals as you like. Please send me 2-3 of your selected pictures and let me know any descriptions you would like to be featured.
 OR
2. A drawing by me on my style.
my website: https://ladantofighi.com/
My commissioned portraits:  https://ladantofighi.com/live-painting/

 

Donor to the Arts ~ €500 or more 

You'll receive four(4) signed A4 prints + An A4 original Artwork

 Original art work could be: 

1. Commissioned portraits: I draw your portraits on water color paper, following my artistic style, as many people or animals as you like. Please send me 2-3 of your selected pictures and let me know any descriptions you would like to be featured.
 OR
2. A drawing by me on my style.
my website: https://ladantofighi.com/
My commissioned portraits:  https://ladantofighi.com/live-painting/

One of my commissioned portraits 

 

Patron of the Arts ~ €700 or more

With this pledge you'll receive four(4) signed A4 prints + A cotton tote bag of your selected pic + An A4 original drawing .

 Original art work could be: 

1. Commissioned portraits: I draw your portraits on water color paper, following my artistic style, as many people or animals as you like. Please send me 2-3 of your selected pictures and let me know any descriptions you would like to be featured.
 OR
2. A drawing by me on my style.
my website: https://ladantofighi.com/
My commissioned portraits:  https://ladantofighi.com/live-painting/

 

 

Hero of the Arts ~ €1400 or more 

Those pledging will receive four(4) signed A4 prints + One of my original painting (The waves of time) from "Another world" series.

 

 

 

ARTIST STATEMENT

 

These paintings belong to my latest series “Another world”. I switched back to canvas and oil colors after some years of working with ink and watercolor to realize the multi-color ideas and dreams which I experienced in the past few months; the world in which the sea is wavy and the mountains are ready to explode. They are colorful and dreamy and convey the world in which you can bloom on the tree or just relax under its shade; through imagination the choice is yours! All the characters are some part of me which appear on canvas honestly.

This project is still in progress.

 

1.Under the orange tree, oil on canvas, 100.120 cm

 

2. The Flourishing Tree, oil on canvas, 70.100 cm

 

3. The waves of time, Oil on canvas, 50.70 cm

 

4. The emancipation in the apocalypse, oil on canvas, 70.100 cm

 

 

What if I raise more than the funding goal?

 

If more than € 4,000 is raised, the extra funds would be used in two ways. First, I would increase the number of paintings, Secondly, any additional funds would be used to help continue my monthly art giveaways throughout the rest of the year. 

 

What  if I don't reach my entire goal?

 

Whatever I collect from this campaign, I will spend for this project and participation in exhibitions.

 

About me

 

 In 2012 I moved to Italy to express myself freely through my paintings and stories. I studied painting at Brera academy and illustration at IED Milano. As a painter and illustrator I also take part in collective exhibitions. I’ve worked for various organizations, small businesses, and individuals. I’m also a live painter for local events.

 My website https://ladantofighi.com/

My email: Ladan6460@gmail.com

Tel: +39 3286676878

Instagram: Ladixx

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

This is not the only way you could support me. I would be most grateful for any support, whether funding, sharing, or both! Thank you in advance

story:
The Wild Wolf Tarot Deck 

If you study spirit animals, you would recognize wolves as leaders and intuitive creatures who embody a free spirit. The way they lead their pack, how they intuitively learn and become one with the land is through their instinct. By following our true path and removing doubt, we learn from the wolves how to be our true self. As we confidently step into our gifts, we are free. 

This deck is meant to help people connect to their ancient wild instincts, and to embrace the many beautiful archatypes of the wolf. 

My Story

The image of the wolf has been one I’ve been connected to ever since I was a child. I loved wolves and their ancestral links to my own dogs I grew up with. I enjoyed seeing their leadership roles in movies like Balto, and the wild instincts I feel from them when I connect with nature. Growing up near a wolf sanctuary in New York, I had the chance to meet wolves face to face when I was very young. There was something about them I always found so striking and impactful. They have remained a powerful spirit guide in my team, and I feel closer to them as I step into my own leadership abilities more and more.

 

Style

Why minimalist? I feel most connected to my spirituality when I am connected with the earth. The style of this deck is earthy, hand-drawn, and minimalist because I wanted the connection with nature to be felt within the cards. Play with them outside as you connect with your wild surroundings or use them in the comfort. of your home to feel your wild wisdom within. 

Major Arcana

Time to embrace the many different archetypes of the wolf. This deck is Rider-Waite inspired but it does provide some unique cards reimagined through the eyes of the wolf. Similar to humans wolves experience love, family, freedom, the shadow self, with these cards we come to understand their nature and how we relate to their experiences.

 

Minor Arcana

The Wild Wolf suits are divided by the important roles of the wolf pack. Each have their own unique personality and purpose which supports the pack. Each role equally important and crucial for success of the pack. 

 

Booklet

I find booklets really important to understand the author and intentions of the deck! Within this booklet you will learn how to...

Create Intentions with your cards 

Shuffle + Cut the deck Intuitively 

Ask Questions to communicate with spirit 

Create 5 different spreads for different uses + purpose 

Read each meaning for all 78 cards with a main + reversed message

Learn "The Lessons of The Wolves" 

DETAILS:

- Matte color laminated cover, 108 pg (estimate), black & white inside, mini guidebook will fit inside the box with your cards.  

Challenges 

1. Possible shipping delays due to Covid19 

This is my first time shipping decks from overseas, although their might be some delays I am in close contanct with my suppliers and keep you up to date! These decks will first come to me and then they will come to you :)  

 

Thank You

Thank you for taking the loving time and energy to experience this deck. Share with your friends, loved ones, anyone who would love this deck. This deck is perfect for anyone who would love a touch of nature in their lives, tarot enthusiasts, and of course wolf lovers like me! Thank You for embracing the wolf and to experience this exciting journey along side me!

Follow the instagram page for this deck to see more!  https://www.instagram.com/thewildwolftarot/

story:
**Above video is of our test rig setup indoors.  We just completed our first test build at a nearby park.  Check out the media section for photos of our structure test build!



What Is Aural Borealis?

Stepping into Aural Borealis will be a mind expanding auditory and sensory experience. Imagine 27 floating archways, extending over 80 feet hovering above you displaying a dazzling array of multicolor LED patterns. The light show produced by the archways are both interactive and audio responsive, meaning you can control the coordinated light patterns of Aural Borealis while it listens to the surrounding auditory environment or stand under the arches and be mesmerized by the colors dancing above your head. Powered by the visual development platform Touch Designer, Aural Borealis has three forms of input; 

1) Maschine midi control (to set your own patterns and alter preformed light sequences),
2) 3D Kinect motion sensors to detect dancing, hand motions, or however your soul would like to express itself, and
3) Audio input, which will dance to the surrounding music. 

Aural Borealis will enable you to express yourself through LED light and animation like nothing else you have seen.

Further, through development of this project and in combination with 3D Kinect motion sensing we are trying to pioneer a new form of interactive, console-less, 3D gaming.  Using gestures, body position, kicks, and punches Aural Borealis will turn into classic games that you control through movement.  Think human pong or 3D LED Streetfighter.  


Touch Designer Environment:


3D Simulation:




Kinect 3D Motion Sensing:



Test rig.  Real time control of smaller LED strips:



Our Goal

Our mission is two in one.  The first is to create an interactive installation to allow people to express themselves through LED light, sound, color, and patterns through an easy intuitive interface contributing to a positive experience of themselves, friends, and the people around them.


Our own personal goals will also be achieved through completion of Aural Borealis.  It will require learning an advanced visual design platform, trouble shooting construction and form to design an installation that is sturdy, able to withstand people and the elements, and be ascetically pleasing.  Therefore, it will require our own growth and knowledge to enhance the experience of those around us.



Where can we see it?

We plan on taking the project to various local festivals in Ontario including OM, Mooseman, & Nuit Blanche.  Modified versions of the project could also be used at indoor events in Toronto.


What We Need 

All of this hardware is not cheap!

We have applied for Art Grants through various local festivals and communities.  However our budget is coming out to around $5000, and this funding has only covered about 1/3 of the total project cost. 

We need your help to hit our final goal so that we can finish the project and share it with all you!

Please share with your friends or help us reach goal and thank you to everyone for your support!
story_txt:
**Above video is of our test rig setup indoors.  We just completed our first test build at a nearby park.  Check out the media section for photos of our structure test build!

What Is Aural Borealis?Stepping into Aural Borealis will be a mind expanding auditory and sensory experience. Imagine 27 floating archways, extending over 80 feet hovering above you displaying a dazzling array of multicolor LED patterns. The light show produced by the archways are both interactive and audio responsive, meaning you can control the coordinated light patterns of Aural Borealis while it listens to the surrounding auditory environment or stand under the arches and be mesmerized by the colors dancing above your head. Powered by the visual development platform Touch Designer, Aural Borealis has three forms of input; 1) Maschine midi control (to set your own patterns and alter preformed light sequences), 2) 3D Kinect motion sensors to detect dancing, hand motions, or however your soul would like to express itself, and 3) Audio input, which will dance to the surrounding music. Aural Borealis will enable you to express yourself through LED light and animation like nothing else you have seen.Further, through development of this project and in combination with 3D 
Kinect motion sensing we are trying to pioneer a new form of 
interactive, console-less, 3D gaming.  Using gestures, body position, kicks, and punches Aural Borealis will turn into classic games that you control through movement.  Think human pong or 3D LED Streetfighter.  Touch Designer Environment:3D Simulation:Kinect 3D Motion Sensing:Test rig.  Real time control of smaller LED strips:Our GoalOur mission is two in one.  The first is to create an interactive installation to allow people to express themselves through LED light, sound, color, and patterns through an easy intuitive interface contributing to a positive experience of themselves, friends, and the people around them.Our own personal goals will also be achieved through completion of Aural Borealis.  It will require learning an advanced visual design platform, trouble shooting construction and form to design an installation that is sturdy, able to withstand people and the elements, and be ascetically pleasing.  Therefore, it will require our own growth and knowledge to enhance the experience of those around us. Where can we see it?We plan on taking the project to various local festivals in Ontario including OM, Mooseman, & Nuit Blanche.  Modified versions of the project could also be used at indoor events in Toronto.What We Need All of this hardware is not cheap!We have applied for Art Grants through various local festivals and communities.  However our budget is coming out to around $5000, and this funding has only covered about 1/3 of the total project cost.  We need your help to hit our final goal so that we can finish the project and share it with all you!Please share with your friends or help us reach goal and thank you to everyone for your support!

story:
Language+: Let’s art a conversation!

Language+: Let’s art a conversation! is a two-venue exhibition and a collaborative educational experience which includes a series of programs that explore the potential for art to be a fruitful language of expression and communication. 

Language+: Let’s art a conversation! has been organized and curated by Qianfei Wang for her thesis at Maryland Institute College of Art’s MFA in Curatorial Practice.


Our Partners

Language+ is partnering with two private schools—The Park School of Baltimore, a non-sectarian, independent and art-based school from pre-kindergarten through grade twelve, and Baltimore Lab School, an exceptional and arts-infused school for students in grades 1-12 with learning disabilities—the project aims to celebrate the process of art-making. Based on each school’s academic curricula, Language+ offers students from different grades opportunities to express themselves and exhibit new artworks. 


Exhibitions

  • Language+ was open to the public at Park School’s Richman Gallery from January 21 to March 16, 2014, with a closing reception on March 6 from 3:00 to 5:30 pm. 
  • The Baltimore Lab School will host an exhibition in their gallery from March 28 to May 23, 2014, and its closing reception will take place May 8 from 4:30 to 6:30 pm. Both receptions are free and open to the public.


Your donation will help us:

  • to print project brochure, 
  • to get materials for additional workshops at Baltimore Lab School,
  • exhibition at Baltimore Lab School.


More information, please visit the project website at: www.languageplusproject.com

story:
NOW AVAILABLE IN OUR ONLINE STORE!!!


Hi guys! Thank you for checking out our project!


A Little About Me (Susan Coffey)

I have been modeling and putting together a body of work for over 5 years. I have worked with over 100 photographers and have reached goals in my modeling career that I never thought would happen. I am grateful for the immense support that I have received and hope to produce some unique projects/products for my fans.


What We're Doing

After an overwhelmingly positive response to my first poster, I wanted to keep the LIMITED EDITION series going! I cannot thank those who supported the first campaign enough. It truly is amazing how much support everyone has provided me and continue to provide me each and every day.

For the second run, I wanted to try something a bit more artistic and fun. I am a huge fan of pin-up modeling and photography and that was the inspiration for the second poster. I'm absolutely thrilled with the results and I can't wait to get everything out to everyone.

Just like last time, printing isn’t cheap so I need your help! If we reach our goal, we’ll be able to produce the next LIMITED EDITION poster for my awesome supporters.

If all goes well, I’d like to continue releasing more print work for my fans. I’d love to continue to be able to give everyone more high quality prints so that people who want to display my work will be able to do so and then their friends can see it too!

We need to raise enough money to print the posters. Our funding goal is basically the exact minimum amount we need to make this happen. For that reason we’re doing an all-or-nothing campaign.

IF WE DON’T REACH OUR GOAL, WE CAN’T PRINT ANYTHING!


Poster

This is our second poster. If this effort is successful, more projects will be on their way so please help us reach our goal!

*Small logos and artistic graphics may be added to the final product.


Rewards For Our Backers

We came up with a bunch of cool reward packages that will only be offered as part of this campaign so act fast! Even if you can only contribute $1, every little bit helps! Every backer will receive exclusive behind-the-scenes email updates from the poster photo shoot and other poster related activities. It will be things I won't post anywhere else!

Personalized High Quality 8x10 Prints - Part of the "Personalized 8x10" package and above, choose from one of these 4 EXCLUSIVE bonus images for Susan to autograph to you.



Every reward level below (except the Poster and Fan levels) will ONLY be offered during this campaign so DON'T MISS OUT!

*Most levels include all perks from previous levels. Check descriptions for details of the few exceptions.


Behind-The-Scenes Video



Shipping 

Domestic shipping (within the USA) is included with every package. For international shipping (anywhere outside of the USA) PLEASE MANUALLY add $15 when completing your rewards package checkout. We cannot send packages internationally without this being included.

If you forget, we will contact you and you will simply need to add the perk labeled FORGOT INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING.

*International shipping is included in the Personal Video, Personalized 8x10, Personal Video & Signed 8x10, 1-on-1 Video Chat, Photo Shoot Producer, Advertiser and Ultimate VIP Experience levels.


FAQ's

Q: How do I choose my custom messages?

A: We will contact you by email at the conclusion of the campaign regarding your choices for personalized items.

Q: Why is international shipping $15?

A: Unfortunately, we cannot control the cost to ship internationally. The price of shipping a large poster tube internationally with the shipping materials costs us $15. We would actually lose money on international orders if we did not add this. We apologize for any inconvenience and we hope that you understand.

Q: Can I add more options to my international shipping?

A: Yes, the default shipping method is United States Postal Service First-Class Package International Service but there are additional options that can be added. If you would like to upgrade your international shipping, please contact us for options. We will also give you the upgrade options when preparing your shipment.


Help Us Spread The Word!

Please share this campaign anywhere you can! Post it on social media, in forums, on gaming servers or wherever else you can think of! There are share tools built right into the campaign and after you pledge there are many options for sharing there as well. Please help us out as it would mean a lot to me!


Contest - Share This Page And Win!

We’re also going to hold a contest for those who help us raise the most funding. If you create a profile on Indiegogo and share our campaign with your profile code (it’s very easy to do), you’ll be able to get share points that we can track. If people back the campaign from your share, it will be credited to you. Whoever helps us raise the most funds will win an awesome and unique prize just for you!


Poster Photographed by Dragon Ink Photography

Outfit by Studio One Lingerie

Makeup by Kats Eye Makeup

Hair by Kalee Mccloud Hair Artist

story:
Short Summary

'Either/or..or..or' is a new Eurasian art collective: David Goldenberg (UK), Maureen Bachaus (NL), Jeton Muja (KS), Bahram Khalilov (AZ) and Ioana Pioaru (RO).

We have been invited by the contemporary art center Flux Factory, to launch our group within the Utopia School Project. This pedagogical project will consist of a whole month of interesting exhibitions, challenging lectures and debates, live performances, and interactive video projects.  We hope you will join us in this experience, either in New York City or online!

What We Need 

We would love to join the project… but there is no artist's fee. If you want to support our work, if you want to be part of the birth of a new art, if you want to take part in challenging debates and interesting lectures, or if you want to participate in interactive international video- and photography projects, please help us. We need a basic budget for tickets and accommodation.

The Impact

With your support, we will be able to carry out this great, artistic and educational project, and besides our eternal gratitude, we will give you a lot in return!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help: Please use the Indiegogo share tools to forward our project!

    References

    The Studio: Glenda Cinquegrana (Italy)
    Varg e Vi, Center for contemporary art (Kosovo)

    Center of Contemporary Art Baku (Azerbaijan)

    Gallery Wansink (Netherlands)

    Gallery S&H De Buck (Belgium)

story:
Short Summary

  • As an artist and photographer, I have been engaged in the Life Imitates Art series (based on a concept by Oscar Wilde) for over three decades. In this ongoing series of photographs, I juxtapose images of contemporary people with their likenesses in works from art history. I find my subjects either by “recognizing” a person I know in a work of art at a museum or in an image in a book, or by seeing someone in everyday life who reminds me of a person or character in a painting from the past. I then approach these individuals, explain my project, and ask if they are willing to collaborate with me in exchange for a finished photograph. I then do the research to find the specific painting or drawing I need, and set up a photo session to create a portrait that replicates the painting in a new way.

    The resulting diptychs, each consisting of a photograph of the living person juxtaposed with the work of art, have been reproduced in magazines worldwide, including the Sunday Magazine of the London Times, The Independent, London, and LIFE:  "Camera at Work", each on several pages.

    Now the time has come to compile the best of this body of work into a high-quality book of 100 images, along with captivating stories of how each model was found. To view a selection of this work, please see my website: www.Nancy-Webber.com.

    Your contribution to this publication project will go toward securing a superb graphic designer for the book, a commentary by a knowledgeable book editor and widely published writer on photography, and toward the production of the book itself.

    I received my MFA in painting from Mills College, Oakland, CA and used these skills in color printing, adjusting skin tones for compatibility with the painting. This series was first exhibited in black and white and then color at OK Harris Gallery in Soho, New York, and at the municipal gallery of Budapest, Hungary.  I also taught in the department of Fine Arts and Humanities at Los Angeles Harbor College.  In the early 1990s I received a J. Paul Getty Fellowship in Visual Arts, Photography, which permitted me to turn my darkroom into a color printing lab. There I printed my Cibachromes, and then Ilfochromes, until that technology, along with 35mm color slide film, was no longer manufactured.  

    My current project is publishing a substantial book.  Most of the cost of the proposed publication will be for scanning the photographs and producing  a print run of 100 copies of the book at a printer in Torrance, California. My goal is to produce a 104-page book in color and black-and-white on 100-pound, white silk paper, with a hardcover binding in 10 x 10 inch format. If my target goal is not reached, the book will be printed in paperback binding in a smaller format.

    In appreciation of your valuable contribution, you will receive the following gifts:

    Donation / Gift listed on Perks page

    $5   Two postcards, 5 x 7 in., from the public art project for the Animal Care Center in San Pedro (see www.Nancy-Webber.com), based on Edward Hicks’s "Peaceable Kingdom" and "Noah's Art," and Henri Rousseau’s "The Merry Jesters" and "Tiger in Thunderstorm," digital collages of rescued animals plus animals depicted in paintings from art history.

    $10  A four-card set of each panel, as described above, commissioned by the City of Los Angeles and installed in 2007. 

    $25   Two color postcards, 5 1/2 x 8 1/2 in. each, of Rossetti's Proserphine and Manet’s The Tipsy Woman.

    $50   One black-and-white archival digital print, 8 1/2 x 11 in., of one of the following photographs reproduced in the book: (a) Brian Blessed (British actor), playing Buster Jones in Cats, as Hans of Antwerp by Hans Holbein; (b) Carl Cheng, Los Angeles public artist, as Cezanne’s son; or (c) William Shatner, actor, as Hans Jacob Fugger by Christoph Amberger.

    $100   One color, limited-edition, digital archival print, 8 1/2  x11 in., of Robert Arneson as Head of Old Man by Cezanne, or Nancy Maurer as Head of Angel by Leonardo da Vinci (50 available); plus a signed copy of the book Life Imitates Art.

    $500  One color, limited-edition, archival digital print 16"x 20" of a work of your choice on www.Nancy-Webber.com, plus a  copy of the book Life Imitates Art. 

    $1000  Two color, limited-edition, archival digital prints of a work of two works your choice on www.Nancy-Webber.com, plus a signed copy of the book Life Imitates Art.    Available 5.

    All donors of amounts of $100 or more will be honored with an acknowledgment in Life Imitates Art.

    Whether or not you are able to participate at this time, would you please be so kind as to forward this campaign information to as many of your friends and associates as possible so Life Imitates Art can be published? Thank you so much for your support of the arts and your valuable participation in this project.

    Sincerely,

    Nancy Webber

story:
Sucker Punched 2

Welcome to Sucker Punched 2! The first iteration of Sucker Punched was so well received, we're bringing it back for more! 

For those of you who are back, welcome! Thanks for joining us for another go 'round! 

To those of you who are new to us, come on in! We are FightGuy Photography - a photography studio based in Northern Virginia, specializing in portraits and events. Sucker Punched is one of our babies. 

Sucker Punched was primarily inspired by the Zack Snyder film, Sucker Punch. We started doing a few shoots, trying to match the tone and style. From there, the project grew and took on a sense of empowerment and agency. We had a lot of models interested in doing a shoot of this style and a lot of fans interested in seeing more. With great power came great responsibility, so we launched last year's campaign to make a full series of these shoots and connected with RAINN (The Rape Abuse and Incest National Network) to make sure we did some good with this project. Sucker Punched was a great success and we all walked away feeling great about it. Well, we're doing it again. More models, new characters and another year of promoting strong, feminine images.

Our goal with Sucker Punched is to present original characters, created in the style of powerful archetypes. We've got designs drawn from the best of fiction, local and regional models who will knock it out of the park, and fine photographic skills to bring it all together. The models involved are presented as a celebration of powerful women, dangerous and strong. This is no "bikini babe" project here, quite the opposite really.

(If you'd like to read a much longer-winded version of what we're all about, check out last year's campaign here)

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • We're looking to raise money to offset our expenses. We need props, costumes, makeup artists and studio time! I'm also very keen on paying the artists who are on board with this project.
  • We're offering you exclusive content including prints, posters, books, calenders, merch and services (Including portrait sessions!) 
  • We are also donating 10% of all funds raised, now and in the future, to RAINN, to help them in their crusade to defend, educate and empower. 
  • Additionally, a large number of our purchases will be made from small, independent artisans, to help support local businesses and artists. 
Last time, we raised $2176 to put towards this project (less Indiegogo's fees). $217.60 immediately went to RAINN; the rest we poured into making the magic happen. 10 characters were created, built, refined and photographed. We produced prints, calenders, a photobook, mugs, and posters and shipped them all over the country to eager fans. This year we are upping the ante to 12 characters (With our stretch goal of 14 if we beat our goal!). We've got big dreams and we want you to be in on them!

SPECIAL MILITARY PERK!

For all active service members, any donation over $15 will include a bonus personalized print and letter from the character of your choice. Just our way of saying "thank you" to all who serve. (Please indicate this when picking your perk)

The Impact

What is this project all about? Well, first, it's a heck of a lot of fun. Moreover, it's a project that creates and promotes a positive message. These characters are feminine and powerful. They have full agency over who they are and what they're doing. In today's world, we can't get enough of that.  Additionally you'll help provide exposure and experience to a number of talented young professionals, dancers, actresses, models, makeup artists and costume designers. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Obviously this project isn't everybody's cup of tea, I completely understand that. If you like what we've done, but aren't interested in joining us, we ask that you:

  • Please share this campaign with your friends. Anyone who's into supporting local projects, indie artists, or photography...someone who loves action movies... beautiful women.... Indiegogo provides lots of ways to share the word around.
  • Take a moment to check out RAINN and the good work they do there. 
About FightGuy Photography

    FightGuy Photography was launched in 2010 by Craig Lawrence, a professional actor, stunt man and fight choreographer. Building on his extensive performance skills, particularly in the realm of movement and theatrical violence, Craig set out to develop a photographic style that could capture the energy, grace and story of any subject. FightGuy Photography has worked with a number of different companies and individuals, providing event, promotional and production photography. For more information, contact us through our website www.fightguyphotography.com

    **FightGuy Photography and the Sucker Punched project are not affiliated with Warner Brothers, Legendary Pictures or the film Sucker Punch. The work presented is original material inspired by a number of sources.**
story_txt:
Sucker Punched 2
Welcome to Sucker Punched 2! The first iteration of Sucker Punched was so well received, we're bringing it back for more! 
For those of you who are back, welcome! Thanks for joining us for another go 'round! 
To those of you who are new to us, come on in! We are FightGuy Photography - a photography studio based in Northern Virginia, specializing in portraits and events. Sucker Punched is one of our babies. 
Sucker Punched was primarily inspired by the Zack Snyder film, Sucker Punch. We started doing a few shoots, trying to match the tone and style. From there, the project grew and took on a sense of empowerment and agency. We had a lot of models interested in doing a shoot of this style and a lot of fans interested in seeing more. With great power came great responsibility, so we launched last year's campaign to make a full series of these shoots and connected with RAINN (The Rape Abuse and Incest National Network) to make sure we did some good with this project. Sucker Punched was a great success and we all walked away feeling great about it. Well, we're doing it again. More models, new characters and another year of promoting strong, feminine images.
Our goal with Sucker Punched is to present original characters, created in the style of powerful archetypes. We've got designs drawn from the best of fiction, local and regional models who will knock it out of the park, and fine photographic skills to bring it all together. The models involved are presented as a celebration of powerful women, dangerous and strong. This is no "bikini babe" project here, quite the opposite really.
(If you'd like to read a much longer-winded version of what we're all about, check out last year's campaign here)
What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

We're looking to raise money to offset our expenses. We need props, costumes, makeup artists and studio time! I'm also very keen on paying the artists who are on board with this project.
We're offering you exclusive content including prints, posters, books, calenders, merch and services (Including portrait sessions!) 
We are also donating 10% of all funds raised, now and in the future, to RAINN, to help them in their crusade to defend, educate and empower. 
Additionally, a large number of our purchases will be made from small, independent artisans, to help support local businesses and artists. 

Last time, we raised $2176 to put towards this project (less Indiegogo's fees). $217.60 immediately went to RAINN; the rest we poured into making the magic happen. 10 characters were created, built, refined and photographed. We produced prints, calenders, a photobook, mugs, and posters and shipped them all over the country to eager fans. This year we are upping the ante to 12 characters (With our stretch goal of 14 if we beat our goal!). We've got big dreams and we want you to be in on them!
SPECIAL MILITARY PERK!
For all active service members, any donation over $15 will include a bonus personalized print and letter from the character of your choice. Just our way of saying "thank you" to all who serve. (Please indicate this when picking your perk)

The Impact
What is this project all about? Well, first, it's a heck of a lot of fun. Moreover, it's a project that creates and promotes a positive message. These characters are feminine and powerful. They have full agency over who they are and what they're doing. In today's world, we can't get enough of that.  Additionally you'll help provide exposure and experience to a number of talented young professionals, dancers, actresses, models, makeup artists and costume designers. 




Other Ways You Can Help
Obviously this project isn't everybody's cup of tea, I completely understand that. If you like what we've done, but aren't interested in joining us, we ask that you:

Please share this campaign with your friends. Anyone who's into supporting local projects, indie artists, or photography...someone who loves action movies... beautiful women.... Indiegogo provides lots of ways to share the word around.
Take a moment to check out RAINN and the good work they do there. 

About FightGuy Photography
FightGuy Photography was launched in 2010 by Craig Lawrence, a professional actor, stunt man and fight choreographer. Building on his extensive performance skills, particularly in the realm of movement and theatrical violence, Craig set out to develop a photographic style that could capture the energy, grace and story of any subject. FightGuy Photography has worked with a number of different companies and individuals, providing event, promotional and production photography. For more information, contact us through our website www.fightguyphotography.com
**FightGuy Photography and the Sucker Punched project are not affiliated with Warner Brothers, Legendary Pictures or the film Sucker Punch. The work presented is original material inspired by a number of sources.**

story:
Bowmaking Passion of a Lifetime

written by Giovanni Lucchi

There was nothing ordinary about Giovanni Lucchi and his craft. He was one of the most famous bow makers in the world. He made bows for stringed instruments that have been placed into the hands of the greatest contemporary musicians.

Maestro Rostropovich with Maestro Giovanni Lucchi

Elegant, a little ‘sly, serious and playful at the same time‘, Giovanni Lucchi stayed focused in his laboratory, but was always open to the world, aiming to grasp every little vibration. The exact moment when it was decided to tell his story was a unique experience. The scarf around his neck, his eyes bright, the rhythm between his fingers, have entrusted us with his triumphs and his weaknesses, his experiments and his failures, his method and his hopes.
This is an autobiography that tries to put a little - ‘not too much‘ - of the order among his memories. Since he was a child, climbing on the stool to face the doublebass (which was much taller than he was), he devised an empirical method for measuring the vibration transmissibility of the wood. He played with friends up and down the Adriatic Coast. He also earned the trust of Rostropovich, creating for him an elastic and springing bow, similar to his intelligence and his passion.

Giovanni Lucchi, bowmaker born in 1942 in Cesena, a town in Emilia Romagna (Italy), died suddenly in Cremona in August 2012, shortly after writing this brief autobiography. These pages contain his memoirs, his principles and his projects, all of which have become his legacy. He has left an invaluable treasure for those who will follow the path he has traced with intelligence, creativity and great passion.

story:
HELP CAPT. KITTY HERRESHOFF AND HIS CREW ABOARD THE VACILANDA SAFELY SAIL TO PANAMA!

 

The crew of the sailing vessel Vacilanda was formed in the summer of 2012 while working together to help build the Boatel project in Rockaway Beach, NY. Formed by some of the members of Brooklyn's Swimming Cities collective, the Boatel was a collection of motor-less motor boats reconstructed into habitable installations using mostly found materials, each by a different artist. For Herre, Pete, and Tory, it became increasingly apparent that their next project would be to rebuild a boat that was not stationary, but could sail around the world. Trading Pete's small vessel, Mariah, for the much larger Vacilanda meant accepting months of restoration, but if they are able to restore the Vacilanda, she could safely carry them and others almost anywhere. Their first sail is from Rockaway Beach, NY, to Isla Bestimentos Bocas del Toro, Panama. The destination is Yemanja Caribe, a hostel and restaurant recently opened by fellow artists of the Boatel, but native to Panama.

 

 

SAILING

Sailing vessels have long outlived other popular forms of transportation for both people and cargo. Wind power is free energy that is available to anyone, and as transportation becomes more dependent on fuels that we destroy our earth to extract, the ability to travel mostly with just wind becomes increasingly valuable to our collective futures. The crew of Vacilanda, while only one vessel, wishes to join the fleet of sailboats currently living by the philosophy of free non-harmful energy. In addition to sail power, the boat uses a diesel engine to motor in and out of ports and difficult areas. The engine that came with the boat, a Perkins 4-108 diesel, needs a complete rebuild, but when finished will have the potential to run on vegetable oil. They will store additional power using solar panels hooked up to batteries which is the source of all of their electronics for navigation lights, water pumps, cabin light, and charging devices. The goal is to live and travel untethered to any local grid.

 

OUTCOMES

The crew will be producing a catalog of their travels, beginning with building the boat, that outlines their route, port stops, local facts, pictures, difficulties, weather, changes to the plan, and cartographic images for each leg of the journey, beginning with Rockaway to Bocas del Toro. This book will be designed for any impassioned sailor or traveller to those coastal regions. Additionally, the Vacilanda will be taking on additional crew throughout the journey as well as those visiting or local to the regions we travel through for day trips and sailing lessons.

 

 

CREW, S/V VACILANDA

 

In­dividual: Captain Kitty Herreshoff

Born: March 29th, 2012

Location: Boatel at Marina 59, 59th St and Beach Channel Drive, Rockaway Beach, NY

Breed: American White Tabby

Vessels:

Born on: Sweet Anissa (Boatel Vessel), artist Catherine Yeager

Adopted to: S/V Mariah; skipper Peter Elwell

First cruise: M/V Sundown; skipper Orien Mcniell

Cruises: M/V Cuddles; skipper Martina Mrongovius, S/V Christina; skipper Sean Rice,S/V Fat Bottom Girl; skipper Peter Elwell, S/V Trouble No More; skipper Christian Gutierrez

 

Post Hurricane Sandy: S/V Mariah sold, Herreshoff becomes part owner of S/V Vacilanda with Peter Elwell and Victoria Censits with the goal of circumnavigating the earth.

 

First Destination Goal Point: Yemanja Caribe, Hostel and Restaurant, Bocas del Toro, Panama; founded by Lamar Iposa Bailey Karamañites and Pascale Boucicaut at Isla Bastimentos

 

Bio: Kitty Herreshoff has always been a boat cat. Named after naval architect, Nathanael Greene Herreshoff, partially known for his catboat designs, Kitty Herreshoff was raised at Marina 59, home of the underground Boatel in Rockaway Beach, NY. Shortly after his birth, Herreshoff moved into his first sailboat, S/V Mariah and began his life with his new crew, Peter Elwell and Victoria Censits. Thus began his love for sailing. After a three-day sailing trip transporting the 34 foot sailboat, S/V Trouble No More, through the Long Island Sound, Herreshoff's dreams of further sailing adventures were born.

 

ADDITIONAL CREW MEMBERS

 

Individual: Peter Elwell

From: New Bedford, Massachusetts, Whaling town.

Bio: Peter grew up around boats and has worked on and sailed various vessels, from Alaskan Cod boats, to Gulf Oyster boats. Since early childhood, he has dreamed of circumnavigating the earth.

 

Individual: Victoria Censits

From: Princeton, NJ

Bio: Victoria has been involved in various collaborative art projects with the focus in construction of spaces using found objects. With a background in graphic design and economics she has a profound interest in mapping, both of geographies and ideas and hopes to create a book of her findings throughout the adventures aboard Vacilanda.

 

 

THE PLAN

The plan was to take S/V Mariah, a 25 footer, the distance to Panama, but when the offer for a 38 foot sailing vessel was made to Herreshoff and his crew they shifted their plans in favor of investing in their new portable home, S/V Vacilanda. Despite the inexpensive cost of the boat in its current condition, the timing and work needed to prepare the boat have made a drastic impact on their plans. Hurricane Sandy hit a couple days after acquiring the new vessel Vacilanda, destroying their home in Rockaway, and leaving the marina with a pile of boats stacked in the parking lot. The crew postponed their plans to leave and began working daily in their neighborhood of Rockaway bringing generators and pumps to houses with water-filled basements and distribution centers in need of power. Additionally, two other potential members of the original crew planning to sail the distance to Panama chose to remain in Rockaway over the winter where they were greatly needed. Herreshoff, Peter, and Victoria have now taken on the life-changing task of outfitting their new sailing home to begin the long, initial trip from New York City to Bocas del Toro, Panama. Sandy was a huge setback for many individuals, families, and businesses, as it was for the Vacilanda crew, but they continue to invest in their goal to make it to their friends in Panama, having already left a job, an apartment, and other opportunities in their wake. The giant diesel engine is now in the process of being completely disassembled, cleaned, and reassembled. The water system is getting new pipes and the electrical is being re-wired. Reinforcements are being made to parts of the hull, deck, and rigging. The crew is doing all of the work on their own to remain within their budget with help only from knowledgable local friends. In preparation for the trip, the Vacilanda crew has been compiling lists of contacts and suggestions, where the wealth of knowledge is mostly found. The three of them plan to catalog their findings, route, ports, destinations, and difficulties along the way, opening up the possibility for others to access valuable information for personal interest of for the purpose of making the same trip. To safely make Herreshoff and his crew's dream of sailing to Panama a reality, they will need the following items:

 

Solar Panel $400

Deep Cycle Batteries $140 x 3 = $420

EPIRB- Emergency locating device ($500-1000)

GPS Antennae and Navigation Program $100

Various construction materials $500

Fuel: Diesel/Propane/Gas $1000

Kitty food/litter $100

 

= $2520 (+ cost of EPIRB)
